sections.title: Section 1: Model Training, Tuning, and Parameters

questions.question: What is the main distinction between model training and model tuning in supervised learning?

options.A: Training selects the best hyperparameters; tuning learns model parameters
options.B: Training learns model parameters; tuning selects the best hyperparameters
options.C: Both refer to the same process
options.D: Training is only used for unsupervised models

questions.question: **(Medium, Select all that apply):** Which of the following are characteristics of model training in machine learning?

options.B: Stops at convergence or when parameters stabilize
options.C: Involves learning parameters to best fit the data
options.D: Only uses closed-form solutions like OLS

questions.question: Why do machine learning models for NLP typically require iterative training instead of a closed-form solution?

options.A: They have more parameters than equations

questions.question: **(Hard, Select all that apply):** Which of the following are true about hyperparameters in supervised models?

options.A: Hyperparameters are set ahead of time, not learned from data
options.B: Hyperparameters can control the training process
options.C: The value of k in k-means is a hyperparameter

questions.question: What is the main purpose of model tuning in supervised learning?

options.A: To find the best combination of hyperparameters for model performance
options.B: To increase the number of features
options.D: To remove all bias from the model

sections.title: Section 2: Model Evaluation, Metrics, and Bias

questions.question: **(Medium, Select all that apply):** Which metrics are commonly used to evaluate regression-type supervised models?
**(Hard, Select all that apply):** Which metrics are commonly used to evaluate classifier-type supervised models?
Why can a highly accurate classification model still be biased?

options.A: It may perform well on the majority class but poorly on the minority class
options.B: High accuracy always means low bias
options.C: Bias only occurs in regression models
options.D: Precision and recall are always equal

questions.question: **(Hard, Select all that apply):** What is the difference between precision and recall in a binary classification context?

options.A: Precision measures the proportion of true positives among all predicted positives
options.B: Recall measures the proportion of true positives among all actual positives
options.C: Precision is always higher than recall
options.D: Recall is always lower than accuracy

questions.question: What is a recommended strategy for dealing with class imbalance and bias in supervised model training?

options.A: Assign greater weights to observations from the minority class
options.C: Only use accuracy to evaluate the model
